short_bio: John Smith is an experienced chef who specializes in Italian cuisine.

recipes.instructions: Cook the pasta. Brown the beef. Add the onions and garlic. Add the tomatoes. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve over the pasta.
Roll out the dough. Spread the tomato sauce. Add the cheese. Bake in the oven. Top with fresh basil.
Dip the ladyfingers in coffee. Layer with the mascarpone mixture. Refrigerate for a few hours. Serve chilled.

short_bio: Maria Garcia is a Mexican chef who is known for her delicious tacos and salsas.

recipes.instructions: Grill the steak. Warm the tortillas. Assemble the tacos with the steak, cilantro, onion, and lime.
Roast the tomatillos and peppers. Blend with the onion, garlic, and cilantro. Season with salt.
Mash the avocado. Add the tomato, onion, pepper, and lime. Season with salt.

short_bio: Julia Lee is a Korean-American chef who specializes in fusion cuisine.

recipes.instructions: Mix the flour, cornstarch, and garlic powder. Coat the chicken wings. Fry until golden brown. Toss with soy sauce.
Cook the sushi rice. Cube the tuna and avocado. Slice the cucumber. Mix with spicy mayo. Serve over the rice.
Chop the bacon. Fry until crispy. Add the kimchi. Stir in the rice. Make a well and crack in the eggs. Mix until cooked. Drizzle with soy sauce.

short_bio: Alexandra Brown is a French chef who has worked in Michelin-starred restaurants around the world.

recipes.instructions: Brown the beef. Add the vegetables. Pour in the wine. Simmer for several hours. Serve with crusty bread.
Brown the chicken and bacon. Add the vegetables. Pour in the wine. Simmer for an hour. Serve with mashed potatoes.
Melt the butter and flour. Add the milk. Stir in the chocolate. Beat the egg whites. Fold in the chocolate mixture. Bake in ramekins.

short_bio: Maria Sanchez is a Mexican chef who specializes in traditional and modern Mexican cuisine.

recipes.instructions: Mash the avocado. Dice the tomato and onion. Mince the jalapeno. Mix all the ingredients. Squeeze in the lime juice. Season with salt.
Roast the peppers. Brown the beef. Add the onion and garlic. Stuff the peppers with the beef mixture. Pour over the tomato sauce. Bake in the oven.
Mix the flour, sugar, and eggs. Bake the cake. Mix the milk and vanilla. Pour over the cake. Let it soak for a few hours. Serve chilled.

short_bio: Hiroshi Yamamoto is a Japanese chef who has worked in top restaurants in Tokyo and New York.

recipes.instructions: Boil the noodles. Cook the pork belly. Boil the egg. Slice the bamboo shoots. Arrange in a bowl. Pour over the broth. Top with scallions.
Cook the sushi rice. Slice the fish and shrimp. Cube the avocado. Roll the sushi. Serve with soy sauce and wasabi.
Make the batter with flour and ice water. Dip the shrimp and vegetables. Fry in hot oil. Serve with tempura sauce.
